poem:
**Shadow and Spotlight**

Princess among stars,
her life a cinema reel,
navigating dreams
and their off-screen scars.
Eighty-eight years,
a memoir of longing—
privilege's glow
dimmed by life's demands,
her wounds composing
pain's aching prose.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Jill Robinson obituary In a series of remarkable and successful memoirs, and in much of her fiction, the writer Jill Robinson, who has died aged 88, drew on the story of her own life, growing up a princess among Hollywood royalty, navigating the capricious path between the spotlight of exalted privilege and the shadow of the kingdom’s call on her parents’ attentions coming before her own. Her work often focused on the pain of trying". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Jill Robinson obituary In a series of remarkable and successful memoirs, and in much of her fiction, the writer Jill Robinson, who has died aged 88, drew on the story of her own life, growing up a princess among Hollywood royalty, navigating the capricious path between the spotlight of exalted privilege and the shadow of the kingdom’s call on her parents’ attentions coming before her own. Her work often focused on the pain of trying
